meanings.definition: A fundamental truth or proposition that serves as the foundation for a system of belief or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The school's guiding principle is to always be kind to others.
meanings.sent2: Honesty is a principle that many people value in their relationships.
meanings.sent3: It's a funny principle that eating ice cream always makes me feel better.
meanings.sent4: The principle of love can heal even the deepest wounds.
meanings.sent5: The principle of gravity keeps us grounded on Earth.

meanings.definition: A rule or belief governing one's personal behavior.
meanings.sent1: Following the principle of 'treat others as you want to be treated' is important.
meanings.sent2: Respecting elders is a common principle in many cultures.
meanings.sent3: I have a principle to always wear mismatched socks on Fridays.
meanings.sent4: The principle of forgiveness can bring peace to your heart.
meanings.sent5: The principle of hard work leads to success in life.

meanings.definition: A fundamental source or basis of something.
meanings.sent1: The principle of the sun being the center of our solar system is well-known.
meanings.sent2: Water is a principle of life on Earth.
meanings.sent3: It's a principle that laughter is contagious.
meanings.sent4: The principle of teamwork can achieve great things.
meanings.sent5: The principle of supply and demand affects prices in the market.
